results.title: The Point
results.creator_credit: Nilsson House Music, Murakami-Wolf Productions, Jerry Good, Larry Gordon, Harry Nilsson and Fred Wolf
results.brief_description: Based on a fable by Harry Nilsson, this delightful family film is set in the land of Point. In Point, every object, including people, is moulded into a point. Into this world little Oblio is born; the first and only roundheaded child in the town. Oblio and his dog, Arrow, are punished for having no point and are banished to the Pointless Forest. It is not as lonely as they imagined for in the forest they meet several other creatures who have also been exiled because they were different. Join Oblio and Arrow as they discover that you don’t have to have a point to be accepted. Narrated by Ringo Starr and animated by director Fred Wolf.

results.title: The Point
results.creator_credit: William Weintraub, ONF | NFB and Robert Duncan
results.brief_description: Point St. Charles is a notoriously bleak neighborhood in Montreal, considered to be one of the toughest in all of Canada. Many of the residents are English-speaking and of Irish origin living in a French speaking community; many of them are also on welfare. It is a district poor in terms of community facilities, high unemployment, lack of educational facilities and opportunities, and juvenile crime. Voice and narration by Budd Knapp.

results.title: The Plunder of peach and plum = Tao li jie [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Ma Dejian, Diantong Film Studio and Ying Yunwei
results.brief_description: China’s first talkie offers a grim picture of the fate awaiting young job-seekers in Shanghai society of the mid-1930s. An idealistic newlywed couple, recently graduated from university, find good white-collar jobs but both quit rather than submit to corruption and coercion in the workplace. However their desire to do the ‘right’ thing, takes them on a downward spiral which eventually leads to tragedy. The film is famous for a sequence which involves a single long tracking shot from an arriving taxi across the pavement, into and across a hotel lobby—an extraordinary feat for the time. Cast includes Yuan Muzhi and Chen Bo’er. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: The Ploughman's lunch
results.creator_credit: Greenpoint Films, Simon Relph, Ann Scott and Richard Eyre
results.brief_description: Reporter James Penfield makes his money rearranging the facts, a talent he ruthlessly exploits in his friendship and love affairs. A political drama set against the backdrop of the Falkland’s crisis, the film takes a wry look at the Government’s attempt to justify the war. Set in the heartland of bourgeois England among media creators and academics, the personal, political and historical deceit of Thatcher’s Britain is ruthlessly exposed. Stars Jonathan Pryce and Tim Curry and features an astonishing climax as the crew and cast filmed undercover during the Conservative Party Conference.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greenpoint Films, Simon Relph, Ann Scott and Richard Eyre

results.title: The Plight of Tibet and the Dalai Lama: interviews with Tibetian refugees
results.creator_credit: Murray Mancha Pty Ltd and John B Murray
results.brief_description: Buddhism became Tibet’s official religion by 800AD. This spiritual thought pacified the people and evolved into a unique form now known as Tibetan Buddhism. China invaded Tibet in 1950, vowing to liberate its citizens from feudalism and Western imperialists. Tibetans rebelled against the Chinese occupation in 1959, but the revolt was quickly and cruelly put down. The Dalai Lama, his life in danger, fled Tibet and was offered sanctuary by India’s first Prime Minister, Pandit Nehru. Since then, more than 120,000 Tibetans have also escaped into exile, most settling in India. This program consists of interviews with Tibetan refugees (predominantly Buddhists persecuted for their religion), including the current Dalai Lama, as well as those people who operate the services in India which assist the arriving refugees. They describe both their treatment at the hands of the country’s rulers as well as the general socio-economic climate brought about by the policies of the government of Tibet.

results.title: The Pledge
results.creator_credit: Pledge Productions, Michael Fitzgerald, Sean Penn and Elie Samaha
results.brief_description: Sean Penn’s third film behind the camera (The Indian runner, The Crossing guard) sees Jack Nicholson reprising his role as a man intent on keeping his word, in this case a promise to the mother of a murder victim to locate her daughter’s killer. Jerry Black (Nicholson) is about to retire when he becomes involved in one last case. The victim is a young girl found murdered in the snow, wearing a red dress and with suspected sexual interference. A witness identifies a man fleeing from the crime and is brought in, confessing before committing suicide. Black believes the girl is the victim of a serial killer and pledges to her mother that he will ensure the perpetrator is found. Continuing his retirement, Black purchases a petrol station in the mountains and begins a relationship with a single mother who has a daughter who fits the profile of the elusive killer that Black begins to call “The Giant”. There is an ensemble cast including Aaron Eckhart, Benicio Del Toro, Helen Mirren, Robin Wright Penn, Mickey Rourke and Harry Dean Stanton, however the film is all Nicholson’s as the obsessive, cautious protagonist who may or may not be pursuing a figment of his own imagination. Based on the book by Friedrich Durrenmatt.

results.title: The Pleasure is mutual
results.creator_credit: Connecticut Films Inc, Joanna Foster and William D Stoneback
results.brief_description: This exceptional film covers the goals of picture book programs, general planning, specific criteria for selection of good books suitable for varying age levels, methods of preparing for the session, and the techniques of group control. All aspects of the subject from broad theory to precise details about technique are covered in this filmed record of story book sessions in day care centre and libraries in the New York region.
